item.title: For Uniqlo’s Founder, Conquering America Is Personal
item.description: Tadashi Yanai champions the U.S. market as vital for Uniqlo’s growth, but remains deeply concerned about rising American protectionism.

item.title: Now Comes the Hard Part for the Gaza Cease-Fire Plan
item.description: Hamas released hostages and agreed to abide by a cease-fire, but persuading it to lay down its arms is another matter.

item.title: Suspect Pleads Guilty in Firebombing of Pa. Governor’s Residence
item.description: Under a plea agreement, Cory Balmer will be imprisoned for 25 to 50 years for the attack on Gov. Josh Shapiro’s official residence in Harrisburg, Pa.,...

item.title: Big Banks Credit ‘Resilient’ Economy for Profit Growth
item.description: JPMorgan Chase, Goldman Sachs, Citi and Wells Fargo reported strong earnings, mostly topping analyst expectations and showing broad growth.

item.title: Hoping to Steady Political Crisis, French Prime Minister Offers to Suspend Pension Overhaul
item.description: The move by Sébastien Lecornu was a major concession as he faced no-confidence votes that threatened to topple his government again this week.
